meanings.definition: The state or condition of being liked, admired, or supported by many people.
meanings.sent1: Her popularity among her classmates made her feel happy and included.
meanings.sent2: The singer's popularity grew rapidly after releasing her hit song.
meanings.sent3: The popularity of the new student in school was so high that everyone wanted to be friends with them.
meanings.sent4: The popularity of the idea spread like wildfire throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The popularity of the restaurant was evident by the long line of customers waiting to get in.

meanings.definition: The quality of being appealing or attractive to a large audience.
meanings.sent1: The toy's popularity among children was due to its bright colors and fun features.
meanings.sent2: The movie's popularity soared after receiving positive reviews from critics.
meanings.sent3: The popularity of the new ice cream flavor was so high that it sold out within hours.
meanings.sent4: The popularity of the fashion trend spread like wildfire among teenagers.
meanings.sent5: The game's popularity was evident by the number of players joining in every day.
